intro: Euphrasia tetragona, commonly known as the four-lobed eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open woodlands, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its small, yellowish-green flowers bloom in early summer, and the leaves are opposite, ovate, and have four lobes. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
